newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan says N.Korea submarine incident 'deplorable'.
newsitem.headline: Japan says N.Korea submarine incident 'deplorable'.

text.p: Japan on Friday said it deplored North Korea's infiltration into South Korea and called on the communist state to halt such provocations.

"We have an interest in peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and it is deplorable that North Korea has brought about this incident," government spokesman Seiroku Kajiyama told a news conference.
"The international community will not accept it. We call on North Korea to immediately end these kinds of actions," he said.
South Korea has said it has so far shot and killed 18 North Koreans from a larger squad of heavily armed infiltrators that landed from a submarine on Wednesday near the east coast city of Kangnung.
